# Recipe: Instapot Easy Paella

## Introduction
Instapot Easy Paella is a delicious one-pot rice dish that originated in Spain. It is traditionally cooked with a variety of ingredients such as rice, saffron, vegetables, and meat or seafood. This recipe provides a simplified version of the classic paella, using an Instant Pot to make the cooking process quicker and easier.

## Ingredients
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 onion, diced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 red bell pepper, diced
- 1 yellow bell pepper, diced
- 1 cup Arborio rice
- 1 teaspoon smoked paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon saffron threads
- 1/2 teaspoon turmeric
- 1 can diced tomatoes, undrained
- 2 cups vegetable broth
- 1 cup frozen peas
- 1 cup cooked chicken, diced (optional for non-vegetarian version)
- Salt and pepper to taste
- Fresh parsley, chopped (for garnish)

## Equipment
- Instant Pot or pressure cooker
- Cutting board
- Knife
- Wooden spoon or spatula

## Preparation Time
- 10 minutes

## Cooking Time
- 20 minutes

## Steps
1. Turn on the Instant Pot and select the sauté function. Heat the olive oil in the pot.
2. Add the diced onion and minced garlic to the pot. Sauté for 2-3 minutes until the onion becomes translucent.
3. Add the diced red and yellow bell peppers to the pot. Sauté for another 2-3 minutes until the peppers start to soften.
4. Add the Arborio rice, smoked paprika, saffron threads, and turmeric to the pot. Stir well to coat the rice and spices with the oil and vegetables.
5. Pour in the diced tomatoes and vegetable broth. Stir to combine all the ingredients.
6. Close the Instant Pot lid and set the pressure release valve to the sealing position.
7. Select the manual or pressure cook function and set the timer for 5 minutes.
8. Once the cooking time is complete, allow the pressure to release naturally for 5 minutes, then quick release any remaining pressure.
9. Open the lid and stir in the frozen peas and cooked chicken (if using). Season with salt and pepper to taste.
10. Close the lid and let the paella sit for 5 minutes to allow the peas to thaw and the flavors to meld.
11. Serve the Instapot Easy Paella hot, garnished with fresh chopped parsley.

## Serving Suggestions
Instapot Easy Paella is a versatile dish that can be enjoyed on its own as a complete meal. However, you can also serve it with a side salad or crusty bread to complement the flavors. For a more authentic Spanish experience, pair it with a glass of Sangria or a refreshing glass of Gazpacho.

## Variations
- Seafood Paella: Add shrimp, mussels, and calamari rings to the paella during the cooking process to create a flavorful seafood version.
- Vegetarian Paella: Omit the chicken and add extra vegetables such as artichoke hearts, mushrooms, and zucchini to make a satisfying vegetarian paella.
- Paella Valenciana: This is the traditional version of paella from the Valencia region of Spain. It typically includes rabbit, snails, and a variety of beans along with the rice and vegetables.

## Tips and Tricks
- Use Arborio rice or another short-grain rice variety to achieve the desired texture and creaminess in the paella.
- Saffron is a key ingredient in paella, as it provides a distinctive flavor and beautiful golden color. If you don't have saffron threads, you can substitute with turmeric for a similar color.
- Allow the paella to sit for a few minutes after cooking to allow the flavors to meld together.
- Be cautious with the salt as the vegetable broth and canned tomatoes may already contain salt. Adjust the seasoning accordingly.

## Nutritional Information
- Calories: 320 per serving
- Fat: 7g
- Carbohydrates: 52g
- Protein: 12g

## Storage and Leftovers
Leftover Instapot Easy Paella can be stored in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days. Reheat in the microwave or on the stovetop, adding a splash of vegetable broth to prevent the rice from drying out.

## Frequently Asked Questions
Q: Can I use a different type of rice for this recipe?
A: While Arborio rice is traditionally used in paella, you can use other short-grain rice varieties such as Valencia or Bomba rice.

Q: Can I make this recipe without an Instant Pot?
A: Yes, you can make paella on the stovetop using a large skillet or paella pan. Adjust the cooking time and liquid accordingly.

Q: Can I omit the saffron if I don't have any?
A: Saffron adds a unique flavor and color to the paella, but if you don't have any, you can substitute with turmeric for a similar color.

Q: Can I freeze the leftovers?
A: It is not recommended to freeze paella, as the texture of the rice may change upon thawing. It is best enjoyed fresh or stored in the refrigerator for a few days.
